intro: Cnicus cichoraceus, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lobed and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in the summer months. It is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
